name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Stovall's Inn

reviews.text: Our family of 4 stayed 5 nights at Stovalls. Upon check-in we found the staff friendly. The room was as we expected, a bit old with 2 queen beds, bar fridge, microwave, tv. However, the room was tidy and good enough for just sleeping. The shower pressure was horrible and there is no fan in the bathroom only a window that looks at the building next door (part of the hotel). I'm 5'7" and had to bend down a bit in order to shower. Imagine how my 6'4" hubby felt, LOL.
reviews.title: Recommended for families and budget travellers

reviews.text: If you need towels or pillows after 10pm you'll have to go to the front desk to get them.
reviews.title: Good location and value
Nice Stay
reviews.text: There is a little giftshop by the front desk.

reviews.title: Never Again!
reviews.text: The kids loved the pools. 2 swimming pools (one was cold though), 2 hot tubs and a 1'5" wading pool. We went there at night. There were lounge chairs and tables too.

It is a short walk (15 mins max.) from the hotel to the parks. Don't walk down Katella to Harbor, it's too far!! Instead walk down Disney Way and cut threw the Grand Californian. Once inside the Californian immediately turn left (Conference Center sign), walk down the hall, once at the end turn right, go out the automatic door then turn left and voila, you are in Downtown Disney. There is an entrance from the Californian directly into California Adventure but you have to be a hotel guest.
reviews.title: OK, but probably try somewhere else next time.

reviews.text: Just returned from a 5day stay last week (week of June 4th). The hotel for the money is what you would expect. They were doing some work on the outside (painting mostly). So the walkways to the rooms were paper lined and a bit tricky to walk on (especially with a stroller). The rooms themselves were basic but could use some updates and touch upes. The beds were comfortable and it was nice having a mini frig and microwave in the room. Everyday we came back to a clean room and everything was re-stocked (towels, cups, etc.) The service was good and staff was polite. The locationis OK but I did wish they had more than one bus running for the Anaheim Resort Trans System. At night waiting for the only bus service for 20 minutes was a bit long at times.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: I would stay again however I would look for something in walking distance to the parks first.
reviews.title: Not too shabby

reviews.text: Well, it definitely wasn't a five star hotel, but it was perfectly fine for our stay at Disneyland. The room was clean and roomy, if a bit outdated. It had the promised microwave and fridge, as well as free wireless internet. The staff was mostly friendly. The breakfast was the same every day, but it was free afterall. The hotel was way too far of a walk after a looong day at Disneyland. But the Anaheim Resort shuttle was effective and fast. Definitely worth the three dollars. I guess I'm not dying to stay at this hotel again and would probably try another hotel in the same price range next time we go, just for variety's sake, but we have no complaints about our stay here.
reviews.title: Amazing vacation!

likes.liked: — good value when you book ahead
likes.disliked: — not much open late around Disneyland, and the girl at the desk overnight was rude

reviews.title: Awesome Stay!
reviews.text: I stayed here with my family a few years ago. A lot has changed, and all for the better. The service in the breakfast room was much faster. The pools and hot tubs were just the right temperature. They have added fridge/micro combos to all the rooms for no charge (we paid for ours a few years ago). There is a great tour to Universal Studios with a free bus trip. I tried the treadmill in the work0out room and it works like new. The view of the fireworks at Disneyland from our hotel room was amazing. And that guy who checked us in can write upside-down AND backwards. Icing on top of an already wonderful cake.

The Stovalls Inn was located within a 5 minute walk to the California Adventure Hotel entrance (which you can access the Disneyland park through). The accomodations were very nice, clean and roomy and very well decorated. They seem to have been renovated/updated recently. We had no problems with a/c or noise, even though our room faced the busy street (there are rooms that do not face the street as well, but we opted for a smoking room). When we arrived we had prompt & early check in. The continental breakfast was standard (cereal, oatmeal, fruit, muffins, toast, juice, etc), and we enjoyed it most mornings. The pools were awesome (one cold pool & one heated, both outdoors), and 2 hot tubs (one hot and one super hot), plus a baby wading pool. The topiary gardens added a nice aura to the pool area. Great place for kids!
reviews.title: Look somewhere else

reviews.text: We've been staying at Stovall's for over 15 years and never been disappointed. Yes, it's a bit dated but when most of your time is spent at Disneyland with your eyes open and at the Hotel with your eyes closed.....who cares!! The rooms have always been clean and well stocked. Fairly quiet. Front desk is always very prompt and accomodating. Never have worried about safety or our vehicle while there. They do have night security. Never a problem with any of security stuff though Staff is friendly. We feel like it's our home away from home.
reviews.title: Good deal for the money

reviews.text: If your looking for frills, this ain't it. If you want designer sheets, wallpaper, carpet.....this ain't it. If you're looking for a clean, family friendly place that is safe, close to Disneyland, friendly and unpretentious, then this is it.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: As far as 2 star hotels go, this has to be the best in class. If you are looking to save some money on your Disney trip, this is a good place to start. Front desk staff were on the ball and very helpful. Rooms were clean and the Housekeeping was great. The contenental breakfast was the big money saver over our 5 night stay considering breakfast at Cocos next door ran about $40 - $50 for 3 adults and 2 kids. Appeared the construction was wrapping up when we arrived. Hotel Management would not let the workers start early or work late in consideration of their guests. We did not even notice it. Will definitely consider this place again for a future stay, especially when I figure it saved me about $800 or so compared to the 3 star across the street.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: This hotel does lack some bells and whistles, but the staff makes up for it. Everyone was friendly, helpful and pleasant. The proximity to the parks is great, if you have older children (or no children) you can walk both ways with no problem. I highly recommend CoCo's next door for meals. Much less expensive than eating in Disney and the staff is very attentive.
reviews.title: Good Alternative for Disney Visit

reviews.text: This is not a hotel for you if you want luxury. This is a basic hotel. The continental breakfast was not as I expected, I have never stayed somewhere that did not have bagels or bananas. Basically you can get cold cereal, plain oatmeal, toast, hardboiled eggs, donuts, sweet rolls, apples, oranges, coffee and juice. I did find the airconditioner to be a bit annoying and the shower was sometimes hot, sometimes not.
reviews.title: Pay the extra Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basic motor inn room with TV, TV guide, tea/coffee/hot water facilities, microwave & fridge, and free parking. Good breakfast.
reviews.title: Good basc accomodation

reviews.text: Well located for Disney parks (10-15min walk), and a good chance of beng first drop-off from LAX shuttles and Universal Studios bus.
reviews.title: Great View; Lots of Noise!

reviews.text: Unsightly and noisy air-conditioning unit.
reviews.title: Get what you pay for...

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Stovall's Inn for 4 nights at the beginning of December. We weren't sure what to expect due to the mixed reviews. Upon arriving, the hotel looked decent and the lobby was decorated for Xmas. The front desk was friendly and we were able to check into our room several hours early.
reviews.title: Love the garden!

reviews.text: The room wasn't very big, but big enough for a family of four to sleep in. Our room did have a frig and micro, and no, we didn't have to pay a fee. The rooms were clean and stocked. We asked for extra pillows and they were delivered in minutes. One complaint about the room: the shower, it was very short and weak. Another complaint: the noise on the main street below. We were on the second floor right next to the main drag, so night noise was bad. It took a couple of nights to get used to it.
reviews.title: Good for the price
